pages.text: Now that you're familiar with $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$(), you see no reason to lug it around like you did in the Middle Ages. You have found a way to convert $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$() into a higher form of energy!$(br)You called it $(c_cyan)I$(c_magenta)n$(c_yellow)k$().

pages.title: Producing & Storing
pages.text: $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$() can be converted to Ink using the $(l:magic/color_picker)Color Picker$(/l) and then extracted into containers, like $(l:magic/ink_flask)Ink Flasks$(/l).$(br2)The only drawback: deprived of it's physical form, there is no way to transform Ink back into $(l:general/pigment)Pigment$().

pages.title: Transfer
pages.text: Ink behaves very much like a liquid. It flows from where it is abundant to where is little.

$(br)When two objects that store Ink are connected - such as a $(l:magic/color_picker)Color Picker$() and an $(l:magic/ink_flask)Ink Flask$() - the Ink between the two containers slowly evens out.$(br)The greater the difference, the faster the Flask is getting filled.
